abstract: Angolan Pres Jose Eduardo dos Santos tells leaders of his party that he will step down from office in 2018; timing of resignation allows dos Santos to preside over nation's next federal elections in 2017.

headline.print_headline: Angolan Leader, in Power Nearly Four Decades, Says He Plans to Quit
headline.main: Angolan President, in Power Nearly Four Decades, Says He’ll Step Down

keywords.value: Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: José Eduardo dos Santos, a former guerrilla who came to power in 1979, has been criticized for human rights violations and rampant inequality in Angola.
lead_paragraph: José Eduardo dos Santos, a former guerrilla who came to power in 1979, has been criticized for human rights violations and rampant inequality in Angola.
